name: My Academics
location: Student Homepage > My Academics Tile
description: The My Academics tile is the primary hub for all academic activities. It provides access to course search, academic planning, enrollment management, and academic progress tracking. It contains four main tabs: Search, Plan, Enroll, and My Academics.
additional_info: Use the 'go to ...' dropdown to jump between: Account Inquiry, My Academics, Personal Data Summary, Student Center, and User Preferences
The Search tab requires at least 2 search criteria to display results
Class search defaults to Birla Institute of Tech & Sci as the institution
My Planner allows moving selected courses to a specific term

name: Registration
location: Student Homepage > Registration Tile
description: The Registration tile provides all tools needed to manage course registration for a given semester. It shows your current class schedule and allows you to add/manage classes, view academic requirements, and update your work location and exam center.
additional_info: Enrollment access is controlled by the university and may not always be available
The shopping cart allows pre-selecting classes before enrollment opens
Work Location & Exam Center must be updated each semester before registration closes

name: My Finance
location: Student Homepage > My Finance Tile
description: The My Finance tile provides access to all fee-related and financial functions. Students can make online payments, view their account balance and transaction history, and check monthly deduction schedules.
additional_info: Online payments are processed through the Payment Gateway (Full Payment option)
Transaction status can be refreshed manually using the 'Refresh Status' button; automatic updates may take up to 24 hours
Charges that cannot be paid online must be settled at the Cashier's office or mailed separately
Payment history shows BITS Transaction Number, amount, payment status, date/time, and bank reference number

name: Demographic Details
location: Student Homepage > Demographic Details Tile
description: The Demographic Details tile provides access to personal and demographic information. It opens the student profile with four main tabs covering personal information, security, credentials, and participation.
additional_info: Personal Information sub-tab displays: Addresses, Names, Phone Numbers, Email Addresses, Internet Addresses, Emergency Contacts, Demographic Information
National Identification Number section supports PAN and other country-specific ID types
Citizenship and visa/permit information can be recorded here

name: Student Center
location: Student Homepage > Student Center Tile
description: The Student Center is a comprehensive dashboard that consolidates all student-facing academic, financial, and personal information in one place. It is divided into three main sections: Academics, Finances, and Personal Information/Profile.
additional_info: Academic Structure Report generates a report of the student's academic program structure
Performance Sheet provides a downloadable or viewable academic performance summary
Fees Receipt allows students to download official fee receipts
Fee Demand shows the fee demand note issued by the university
Open Enrollment Dates link shows the upcoming registration window
Milestones section displays program milestones and their completion status
To-Do List section shows pending action items assigned to the student

name: Self Service > Student Pre Registration
location: NavBar > Navigator > Self Service > Student Pre Registration
description: Allows students to complete pre-registration steps required before the main enrollment window opens.
additional_info: Accessible via NavBar > Navigator > Self Service

name: Self Service > Class Search / Browse Catalog
location: NavBar > Navigator > Self Service > Class Search / Browse Catalog
description: Search for available classes across all subjects, or browse the full course catalog. Allows filtering by subject, course number, semester, career, and open/closed status.

name: Self Service > Academic Planning
location: NavBar > Navigator > Self Service > Academic Planning
description: Tools to plan your academic journey by managing your course planner, shopping cart, and course history.

name: Self Service > Enrollment
location: NavBar > Navigator > Self Service > Enrollment
description: A comprehensive section for managing all enrollment-related activities including class schedules, adding/editing classes, viewing grades, exams, and milestones.

name: Self Service > Campus Finances
location: NavBar > Navigator > Self Service > Campus Finances
description: A comprehensive financial management section covering fee payments, account summaries, bank accounts, and financial aid promissory notes.

name: Self Service > Campus Personal Information
location: NavBar > Navigator > Self Service > Campus Personal Information
description: A full suite of personal information management pages covering contact details, credentials, preferences, and identity information.

name: Self Service > Academic Records
location: NavBar > Navigator > Self Service > Academic Records
description: Access academic records, transfer views, enrollment verification, and links to the Learning Management System.

name: Self Service > Degree Progress / Graduation
location: NavBar > Navigator > Self Service > Degree Progress/Graduation
description: Track your progress toward degree completion and manage graduation applications.

name: Self Service > Admissions
location: NavBar > Navigator > Self Service > Admissions
description: Manage admissions-related applications, specifically for minor program admissions.

name: Self Service > Student Admission
location: NavBar > Navigator > Self Service > Student Admission
description: For prospective or newly admitted students to manage their admission process.

name: Self Service > Involvement
location: NavBar > Navigator > Self Service > Involvement
description: Track your involvement in university activities and explore giving opportunities.

name: Self Service > Faculty Center
location: NavBar > Navigator > Self Service > Faculty Center
description: Faculty-specific tools for managing Ph.D. students and approving thesis and dissertation requests. Also accessible by students enrolled in Ph.D. programs.

name: Self Service > Program Enrollment
location: NavBar > Navigator > Self Service > Program Enrollment
description: Manage program-level enrollment agreements and terms.

name: Self Service > Important Notices
location: NavBar > Navigator > Self Service > Important Notices
description: View important notices and announcements published by the university for students. Opens in a new window.

name: Self Service > Student Registration Confirmation
location: NavBar > Navigator > Self Service > Student_Reg_confirmation
description: View or download your official registration confirmation document for the current semester. Opens in a new window.

name: Self Service > Student Registration Details
location: NavBar > Navigator > Self Service > Student Registration Details
description: View comprehensive registration details for your current or past semesters. Opens in a new window.

name: Self Service > Monthly Deduction Details
location: NavBar > Navigator > Self Service > Monthly Deduction Details
description: View the month-by-month fee deduction schedule applicable to your account. Opens in a new window.

name: Self Service > MoU Proposal
location: NavBar > Navigator > Self Service > MoU Proposal
description: Submit or view a Memorandum of Understanding (MoU) proposal, relevant for sponsored or company-linked students. Opens in a new window.

name: Self Service > Minor Application
location: NavBar > Navigator > Self Service > Minor Application
description: Apply for a Minor program from within the Self Service menu. Opens in a new window.

name: Self Service > Specialization Details
location: NavBar > Navigator > Self Service > Specialization Details
description: View the details of your registered specialization within the degree program. Opens in a new window.

name: Self Service > Approve/Deny Ph.D. Thesis Req
location: NavBar > Navigator > Self Service > Approve/Deny Ph.D Thesis Req
description: Approve or deny Ph.D. thesis submission requests. Primarily a faculty/supervisor function accessible from the student portal. Opens in a new window.

name: Institute Level Reports > MOU Repository
location: NavBar > Navigator > Institute Level Reports > MOU Repository
description: Access the repository of MoUs (Memoranda of Understanding) at the institute level.

name: Practice School > Review Offshoot Scores
location: NavBar > Navigator > Practice School > Review Offshoot Scores
description: Review scores from Practice School offshoot evaluations. Relevant to students on Practice School (PS) stations.

name: Records and Enrollment
location: NavBar > Navigator > Records and Enrollment
description: Administrative-level records and enrollment processing tools.

name: Student Financials
location: NavBar > Navigator > Student Financials
description: Financial reporting and charge management tools.

name: Worklist
location: NavBar > Navigator > Worklist
description: View pending workflow items assigned to you that require action (approvals, reviews, or tasks).

name: Global Search
location: Top Navigation Bar (all pages)
description: A global search bar available on every page that allows students to quickly find pages, features, or content across the SIS portal. Search can be scoped to 'All' or narrowed to 'Navigator' items.
additional_info: Accessible via the magnifying glass icon in the top navigation bar
Supports two search scopes: All and Navigator

name: Notifications
location: Top Navigation Bar (all pages)
description: A notification center that displays system alerts, academic reminders, and action items from the university. Accessible via the bell icon in the top navigation bar.
additional_info: Accessible via the bell icon in the top navigation bar

name: Actions Menu
location: Top Navigation Bar (all pages)
description: A contextual actions menu (three-dot icon) that provides page-specific actions such as: New Window, Personalize Homepage, Add to Homepage, Add to NavBar, Add to Favorites, Help, and Sign Out.
additional_info: Sign Out: Logs out of the SIS portal
New Window: Opens the current page in a new browser window
Help: Links to PeopleSoft Online Help documentation

name: NavBar
location: Top Navigation Bar (all pages)
description: The Navigation Bar provides three access points: My Favorites (starred/bookmarked pages), Navigator (full hierarchical menu of all portal sections), and Classic Home (legacy PeopleSoft home page view).
additional_info: My Favorites: Quickly access pages you have bookmarked
Navigator: Browse the full portal menu tree organized by category
Classic Home: Access the older PeopleSoft-style home page
Change My Password: Available from Navigator root
My Personalizations: Customize portal appearance and behavior
My Feeds: Access RSS/Atom feeds if configured
